overview: This subject introduces a variety of methods and philosophies for the analysis of Western tonal and atonal music, each with its own strengths and limitations. Students undertake practical analysis assignments using different techniques, as well as a final project analysing a work of their own choice.
intended learning outcomes: analyse musical works in a variety of styles using appropriate techniques;
present musical insights clearly, within the notational conventions and terminology of particular analytical methods;
make informed choices about methods of analysis applicable in different contexts.

assessments.description: 3 written assignments – analysis (20% each) equivalent to 800 words each.. 2400 words (total)
2 written assignments – analysis (5% each) equivalent to 200 words each.. 400 words (total)
Final written assignment (free choice analytical project). 1200 words (equivalent)

Semester 1.Contact hours: 36 hours, comprising one 2-hour lecture and one 1-hour tutorial per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
